text: Draft at Jealous Monk. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Big floral and grapefruit notes on the nose. Lovely hop flavor on the tongue. Finished crisp and clean. A damn nice beer.

Pouring at Sierra Nevada Beer Camp 2016 in Boston. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Cool straw and citrus on the nose, musk. Medium bodied, earthy slot onion and caramel on the finish.
ABInbev should buy this company. Vermont needs this kind of deal. A well made session that is perhaps a little too bitter would position them well in the Founders all day market.

Draft at Blackback. Hazy pale/gold pour dense creamy frothy white head, lasts forever with big sheety lacing. Aroma is whoa big: flowers and candied grapefruit, dank and earthy to boot. Light sweetness, hints of caramel, cracker malt, moderate bitterness, big hop flavor. Light body, lively carbonation, oily texture. Overall: delicious, impressive session IPA.

Can. Clear gold with chill haze lasting head and lace. Beautiful pineapple mango lemon floral grassy aroma. Medium light tropical fruit sweetness with medium assertive citrusy lemon drop bite riding assertive carbonation in a light body. Excellent.

Draft at City Tap House in Boston. Slightly hazy golden color with a one finger white head. The aroma is nice, citrusy with grapefruit and lemon, somewhat restrained. Flavor is nice and pleasant, pale/caramel malts balanced by citrus hops, medium-mild bitterness. Light on the feel, well carbonated. Pretty good SIPA.

12oz can. Pours clear orange with a moderate white head. Aroma is grass, floral hops, pine, and citrus. Taste is lime and grapefruit with a hint of cracker, a little grass, and a little pine. Lightly herbal. Moderately bitter. Light body. Lively carbonation. Crisp, light mouthfeel. This tastes very, very similar to Two Roads Lil Heaven.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a very lightly hazed pale yellow color with a thick white head - went to batchroom and the head finally dissipated. Aroma was lots of citrus notes, lemon, perhaps a little bit of grapefruit. A touch of grass with some very light herbal, resin notes.
12 ounce can. Pours a somewhat hazy gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and floral. Taste is citrus, tropical, floral, and malt. Refreshing.

Tap. Pours golden and clear with bubbly lace top. Aroma is hay, floral, grass, dough, citrus, but only in review. On casual encounter this is a hoppy beer. Initially taste is one of medium sweetness, but bitter sour notes build. Body is medium and texture is sticky. Carbonation is average to lively with a bitter finish. A refreshing session IPA.
Haze from bottom on yellow pour. Aroma is citrus zest and light fruit. Flavor is light lemon and solid bitter. A lot of flavor

Can bottled March 10. Pours clear pale yellow with big foamy white head. Nose malt floral hops and citrusy hops. Quite fruity and mellow. Taste mellow hops.with malt. Fruity and floral. Overall highly drinkable and work balanced but not very complex. Still pretty awesome.

Can pour. Intense grassy aroma. Pours a slightly cloudy amber. Medium to high bitterness, with strong hops. Intense flavor for a session. Great session. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sucks that my can 6 months old but lets hope for the best. Hazy apricot with an average white head that leaves ok lacing. Aroma is stale as expected. Mostly pine, citrus, and caramel. Taste is citrus and tropical fruit. Mango, grapefruit, and orange big time. Some stale pine and caramel as well. Fairly sticky. Overall good considering age. I bet fresh is awesome.

I enjoyed my first Lawsons finest beer (Sip of Sunshine) last week, so I decided to "hop" at the chance to try their session IPA counterpart. Its got a faint piney kinda citrusy smell. At first sip, I wasnt too impressed. It tasted kind of flat and much like any other session IPA (similar to Bluepoint Mosaic for example) with a smooth but undetailed hop attack. However, after a few more sips, the beauty of this beer revealed itself with some more diverse flourishing of the hop profile and concluding in a satisfying piney, papery, almost pilsnery finish. Ultimately, this is a very fine session IPA, but doesnt really justify the 14-15 dollar price point I often see six packs of 12ozers going for. Still it is worth a try if you like this style or brewery. Goes well with returning to the place where you met the love of your life (and the person you share this beer rating account with)!

Clear golden color with off-white head. Aroma is dank and grassy, really fresh. Taste starts really hoppy and slightly malty but not sweet. Not bitter either, really well balanced. Grassy hops, bright and green flavors. Light body but smooth, medium carbonation. Overall its a great session IPA.
Can. Nice citrus Arabia and taste. Slight bitterness. Very drinkable. Would drink regularly if available in wa

Une bière blonde et ambrée, claire, avec une bonne carbonatation et peu deffervescence. Au nez, le houblon est bien présent, lamarillo donnant au liquide une intensité olfactive assez résineuse à cette session. En bouche, lamertume est définitivement ce quon remarque le plus avec un côté forestier très important. Le corps est bien fait, avec une rondeur pertinente pour une session. Les saveurs sont peut-être un peu décevantes, lamertume emportant son lot de saveurs aux oubliettes. Au final cest bien mais pas inoubliable.

From the 12 fl. oz. can stamped 09/23/16. So it is two months old. Unfiltered murky golden-yellow pour with a big white head that lingers. Sediments. Robust aroma of herbs, spices, anise, orange, and a dank quality. Toasted pale malts under it all. Medium or better body, which was a little unexpected for a Session IPA. The taste has lost a little hop luster in two months but still enough spice, herbal, and toasted characters to keep me happy.

Easy drinking from a can. A month old from canning date.
Aroma of apple, sweet hops, flavors of melon, Medium body.
Appearance is translucent hiney amber with a lingering head Palette is slightly stucky and bitter on the back end
Not a super beer, but an enjoyable one.

Can thanks to Kyle, thanks! Pours a clear light yellow with head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of grass and hay with a bit of marijuana underlying. Flavor has earthy citrus and grass with light marijuana and light grains supporting.

Clear golden with a thin white cap. Delightfully bold hoppy nose with floral resins, passion fruit, lemon zest and grapefruit zest. Crisp and smooth flavor thats not afraid to be grapefruity pithy and zesty, brightly hopped and bitter enough to hold its own, with a light crisp finish. Very keen.
Nicely done. Pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Citrus aroma. Very smooth, with a light hop finish.

6-pack of 12 oz cans (dated 9/23) for $12.99 from Mile High Wine & Spirits. Slightly hazy golden appearance with a white head and light lacing. Aroma of floral hops, citrus zest, cereal and toasted grain. Similar flavor, adding mild to moderate bitterness and a light sweetness. Light body with a crisp feel and a light dry finish. A nice, easy drinker overall and it certainly stands out in this category. Well done LFL.

Can poured into a wine glass. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. They aroma has pine, lemon balm, a bit herbal. Juicy and sweet taste. Moderate bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation.
Can. Cloudy gold with a small, off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of dank pine, grapefruit, lemon zest, biscuit. Flavor is the same. Light plus bodied, smooth with a dry end.

Aroma is bright and energetic. Fresh citrus and summer flowers. Taste is juicy and ligthly sweet with soft malts and a clean, smooth mouthfeel. Slight honeydew melon sensation going on together with light, grassy bitterness and overall super-tasty session IPA.

Can. Clear golden body with a frothy white head. Bright aroma of citrus, orange, lemon, floral hops, toasted grain. The flavor moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Taste of citrus, light pine, tangerine, biscuit. The beer relies more on flavors than bitterness unlike so many session IPAs. Well made.

Can. Grapefruit citrus hop aroma with notes of floral and pine resiny hops with a bit of biscuity malt in there as well. Pours clear golden colored with a large, soapy white head that has excellent retention but little lacing. Starts with grapefruit hop flavor and acidity with a little bit of biscuity malt. Finishes dry but quite smooth with mild bitterness from the floral and pine resin hop flavors before the grapefruit acidity settles on the palate and lingers after each sip. Nice session IPA.
Gift can from Jc1762. Bold orange body with medium body. Nose is hoppy, skunky, citrus. Taste is hoppy, floral, citrus. Nice biscuit in there. Subdued creamy texture with citrus bursts.

Can recently picked up in ct..dated 9.23.16..pours a typical golden orange that is familiar to higher octane doubles, no real haze or particles here but none needed, nose is nice with muted kiwi essence, honeydew melon..some lime..really nice action with some bitterness held in check by the juicy fruits..mouthfeel is really solid, great take on a session ipa..would easily love to have this more readily available, would drink a ton of this if that was the case..definitely one of the best session ipas I have had, worth seeking out a fresh can, great stuff...

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Can shared at Travlrs departure tasting. Poured into a pilsener glass showing well filtered yellow with two fingers of foam. 

The nose shows notes of lime, kiwi, and pears.

The palate is lightly carbonated and medium bodied with the same light flavors of pears, lime, kiwi, and pineapple. Clean and easy, a simple beer.

Can at Travlrs DC Departure RateBeer Tasting. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of grapefruit and lemon citrus, light floral. Tastes of citrus, floral, lemon. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Overrated session IPA.
Pine and some light citrus. Hazy golden pour with good head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Nice stuff, with good hops presence and easy drinking. Can.
From a bottle at the RateBeer gathering 9/9/16. Courtesy of Huzhabendah. Thanks! Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of grapefruit and orange. Bitter finish.

Can @ Farmhouse Tap & Grill. Clear golden beer with a soapy white head. Somewhat on the sweet side, but its at least acceptable. Some gummy bears, peach, and apricot. Lots of orange marmalade as well. Very, very minimal bitterness. Some bread, caramel, and stone fruits. Kind of a grassy finish. Its okay.

Pours amber with a thick, creamy, white head that stays permanently. Wild amounts of lacing. Nose is piney with heavy citrus notes. Taste is decidedly bitter, but with a solid malt backbone. Thin to medium body. Excellent brew.

Can from a random unknown friend.... Bright orange in color... medium head that faded quickly. Nose is flowers, hay/straw/grass...Taste is lite citrus, flower, hay/straw, malt biscuits. Body is super light and refreshing without being watery... Crushed it. Overall: Good shit

Can @ Traintasting: Served in a taster:
Super session 2
Hazy bright yellow with a white head on top.
Aromas of hops, hop fruit, manure, floral hop tints... Quite inviting!
Flavours of hops, bitters, floral, hop fruit...
Aftertaste is bitter, fruity, hoppy, floral...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Can from a female friend who just came back from Vermont, and is the head chef of a local brewpub, and she kicks major ass. The pour is hazy golden with 3-fingers of fluffy, white head. Nose is pale malt, florals, tangerine. Tastes pale malty, with notes of florals, pine, tangerine, white pepper. Smooth finish. Yet another excellent IPA from these guys.

Lawson's super session number 2 one of my favorites. Nice light and hoppy session IPA 4.8%. Amarillo hops. Light fresh and damn tasty!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. can, courtesy of BuckeyeBoy (thanks a lot, man), pours a clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma is very floral and soapy, with floral hops and gentle biscuity malt. Flavour brings out floral hops and gentle biscuity malt. Pleasant and unobtrusive, but nothing special. Solid stuff.
12oz can pours out golden topped with a white head. Nose is tropical melon hops some dank notes. Taste is more of the melon tropical fruit hops and a nice rich malt.

Cannette. Liquide voilé à la teinte claire surmonté dune mousse blanche, onctueuse et déstructurée qui colle au verre un certain temps. Explosion de houblons fruités au nez qui vont de lananas au melon, en passant par la poire et le fruit de la passion. Liquide de faible densité en bouche dont je jouis pleinement de la légèreté. Bulles très agréables qui conjugués aux houblons, apportent fraîcheur et extrême buvabilité. Les houblons offrent maintenant une résine intéressante qui balance bien les fruits tropicaux sans être toutefois la bombe de fruits qui métait dabord montée ai nez. Amertume faible, buvabilité incomparable, une très belle bière, plus aromatique que savoureuse.
On tap at Prohibition Pig. Super citrus aroma. Super citrus taste. Great balance. Love it.
Very floral citrusy hops. Mouth feel is a little over carved but it totally works for this light refreshing pale ale. Best Ive ever had in the style.

On tap at the Three Penny Tap. Pours a cloudy light honey color with a fluffy cream head. The smell is floral, citrus and tropical fruit. The taste is huge citrus, touch of pine resin, grainy ending crisp and slightly bitter. Light in body and smooth.
Clear golden, small light head. Very piney, light lime. Floral. Lightly bitter. Crisp and dry, very little malt. Light clean body, short finish. "crushable". Excellent.

Golden colored pour, small head. Aroma of citrus. Light citrus fruit, moderate citrus hops. A surprising amount of flavor and sweetness for a session. One of the best sessions, which isnt a style that normally thrills. Got too sweet and lost its refreshiveness as it warmed, which is my fault for letting sit by the grill. Good beer.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Can: The aroma consists of light-moderate citrus, tropical fruits, light grapefruit, and lemon peel. It pours a slightly hazed golden-orange with a one finger white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. There is some minimal thin webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate citrus with a touch of tropical fruit. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, mild pine, and a touch of lemon peel. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Can shared by Countbeer, train tasting. Lightly hazy pale golden color, small white head. Aroma is malts, superbly hoppy. Taste lightly malts, hops, bitter hops, a slight piney hop touch. Dry finish. A bit thin texture, average carbonation. Decent.
Pour from can, cloudy orange pour with thick cream white lasting head, very crisp and refreshing, some citrus and resin, excellent

12 oz can shared with ebone1988. The pour is a darker orangey gold with a thin film of white head that had has a nice bit of lace and a thicker collar. The aroma is dank as hell. There is a ton of Amarillo in this. The bitterness, the dankness, everything. There is so much Amarillo and Im not a fan of this particular hop. The flavor is much of the same. The dank and bitter hops are just all Amarillo. The mouth feel is pretty great. Its light and crisp with a light carbonation and a a lingeringly bitter and dank hop. Its an interesting brew, but this just plays to my dislike of the Amarillo hop.

Can shared with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, citrus, pine, grassy, great. Appearance is golden amber, off white head, hazy. Taste is citrus, dank, resin, tropical fruit, light and refreshing. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, dank pine aftertaste. Overall, a really really great session.
Proletariat, NYC tap: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is grapefruit and lemon. Taste is lightly bitter. It be pretty citrusy. Not watery. Nice mineralish body. Light citrusy aftertaste. Good.

UPours cloudy bright orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, pine, dank hops, tropical fruits, grassy hops, and light biscuit malts. Taste is about the same as the aroma. Has a medium body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long finish. Overall, a excllent session IPA that is super refreshing and drinkable.

Can picked up at a Burlington beer store. Consumed with commonshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche outside at the hotel. Light straw golden. Aroma is hop forward with nice pine and floral qualities. Taste is mostly pine and citrus peel from hops. Maintains a healthy malt balance as a backbone. Fits the description of a session IPA perfectly. Almost a hint floral notes accenting the finish. Perfect for a sunny, early summer day.
Can in Burlington with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Very smooth and easy to drink , a bit oily. Lightly flavored and hopped. Very good for this style.

Can beer. Citrus hops aroma. Unable to see beer in can. Citrus tropical fruit up front, malt middle, slight hop finish. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can @ Malt and Mold. Slightly cloudy pale yellow with large foamy white head, faint citrus aroma, medium carbonation, lightly bitter citrusy taste, thin body, long citrus peel finish. Very refreshing brew.

Eh, it was OK. It started out tasting like carbonated water with lots of minerals, but towards the middle of the cans I drank, it started tasting a bit better. Nothing special at all. Wouldnt have been anythign without the Lawsons name on it.
Pours gold with a small white head. Aroma is resin, citrus and earthy. Taste is moderate bitters with juicy citrus tartness. Light bodied, smooth, clean finish and excellent session.

Draft at Monks. Hazy yellow gold pour with lasting white foam that left some thick lace. Huge floral hop nose. Complex mix of grassy floral hops. Gently sweet pale malts underneath. Meyer lemons. Camomile. Thyme. Dandelions. Bee pollin. Clementines. Fresh pineapple. Substantial and full but also dry and light.
12oz can. Poured a yellow color with an off white head Floral pine, citrus, and some bready notes.
Forgot to rate this when i got it from John. Oops, anyways it was delicious and lasted about 40 seconds. Sorry this rating sucks.

Can. Aroma of ?. Detectable candied fruit, wheat, malt, caramel hop. Flavor is predominately hop, pine, orange peel and grass. Clean and balanced. Drinkable but what am I drinking? A subtle hoppy beer.
Draft at Railroad. Pours clear golden yellow with peerage head that fades quickly. Aroma is mild tangerine, lemon and cereal. Taste is similar with a clean citrus finish. Very light and bright.

Aroma citrus, fruity, juicy, 
Appearance golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate medium body, 
Overall a super juicy iPad with little bitterness. Very enjoyable and crushable on a warm summer day. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Clear golden pour with a thin white head and light lacing ..... Aroma of piney and citrusy hops, Amarillo all the way grapefruit mostly .... Taste is of caramel malt, piney and citrusy hops, grapefruit, rindy ...... Has a dry and rindy finish with lingering citrusy hops flavors ... Solid session IPA

Can to pint. Looks good; a mostly transparent golden orange with white head. Smells and tastes of Amarillo hops with a pleasant medium light-bodied mouthfeel. The hops are nice on the nose, but even more robust on the tongue. A very good SIPA.

Tasted from can. Pours a hazy light golf with white head. Aroma is mostly citrus with lemon and grapefruit along with a faint pine aroma. Taste is moderately bitter with citrus flavor. Lemon, grass, tropical fruit, caramel. Excellent session. Definitely one of the best sessions I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Six pack of cans from CT. Pours out a slightly hazy clear light golden color. Lacy white head. Big aromas of grassy citrus. Herbal-citrus-grapefruit flavors. With a decent malt backbone. Very good.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Gold pour. Floral aroma, citrus with lighter pine notes in the aroma and taste. Orange, lighter biscuit malt. Lighter to medium body and very slam-able.
Tap at three penny taproom. Pours gold. Smells great. Petes tame. Hoppy, juicy, chewy. Grate.
Thanks to Tristan for the can. Hazy yellow pour with big whitehead. Huge citrus nose really nice. Clean light malt with lots of citrus taste. Light bitterness, really nice.

Can. Aroma is huge mandarin orange and pineapple, also some mild pine and flowers. Tastes mildly bitter. Pineapple and flowers mostly with some light lingering citrus. Mouthfeel is slightly grainy. Very good overall.

On tap at Three Penny. Clear orange. Smell is grapefruit and pine hops. Light grain. Tastes similar. Lots of grapefruit. Orange sweetness. Surprisingly smooth malt flavor. Low bitterness, but a bit in the finish. Light body. Very drinkable. Nice session IPA.

Can, 330 ml, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savoured on March 16 2016; eye: golden, clear, no effervescence, ring of off-white head, average lacing; nose: hops, pine, orange, tangerine, grapefruit; mouth: hops, pine, orange, tangerine, light astringency, malt, grapefruit, semi-dry finale in pine with presence of tropical fruits, medium body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite likable
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Canette, 330 ml, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savourée le 16 mars 2016; il : dorée, limpide, pas deffervescence, anneau de mousse blanc cassé, dentelle moyenne; nez : houblon, pin, orange, tangerine, pamplemousse; bouche : houblon, pin, orange, tangerine, légère astringence, malt, pamplemousse, finale semi-sèche en pin avec présence de fruits tropicaux, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien aimé
Poured from can dated 2/22/16 hazy golden color with a nice white head. Aromas of dank citrus pine and malt. Taste is juicy with notes of pineapple and dank hop. Nice.

Can shared by Josh, thanks for the opportunity!
Hazy light gold color smallish white head. Juicy fruity hops with light bready malt. Decent beer, but Im still not a fan of the "session" ipa.

Canette sans date. Robe dorée légèrement trouble avec un mince voile de mousse. Arômes dagrumes sucrés. Pamplemousse, tangerine, mangue. Un peu résineuse. Bien houblonné, présence de malt. En bouche, cest plus le pamplemousse qui ressort. Un peu de zestes dagrumes, tangerine, pin. Très goûteuse pour une session mais à 4.8%, on se rapproche tout de même plus de la pale ale standard. On est loin des saveurs de grosses pointures de LFL mais une bière qui laisse boire.
Aroma of dankness and passionfruit, some pineapple. Appears pale gold, clear, a ring of head. Tastes dank of hops and of clean unroast malt. Overall, very nice.
Creamy head. Typical session ipa nose. Cloudy yellow appearance. Solid flavor. A little thin non mouth feel. Decent session, but nothing amazing.
Tap at Reservoir, Waterbury. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hops and malts. Simple but clear.

Nice malt balance with hood punching though. Hazy golden color and very easy drinking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly cloudy deep yellow. Nose is green and citrus hops, slightly earthy. Flavor follows with nice hop bitterness. Has that odd slightly pool chemically thing going on I always get from session IPAs, but less than most.
12oz can purchased in Warren, VT. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Delicious IPA, probably the finest session IPA money can buy.

Can. Pours cloudy straw/hay color with thick white head. Aroma is Grapefruit and Pineapple citrus. Taste is sweet pine/dank with a little pineapple and a bitter hoppy grapefruit finish. Great session.

July 16, 2015. On tap at Three Penny Taproom.
Light hazy golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity with orange, grapefruit, pineapple, light herbal and some biscuit notes. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is light dry grassy and herbal bitterness, light sweet fruitiness with some pineapple and orange. Light to medium bodied, slight oily soft carbonation. 
Great session IPA with a quite creamy texture for the low ABV.

On tap at Blackback Pub. Aroma: loads of citrus which I enjoy. App: clear golden, small white head and good lacing. Taste and palate: thin body, fruity but not that much, on the limit of being watery, moderate high carbonation, medium bitter finish. Overall: easy to drink, maybe a bit too much carbs for a session. Anyway, good session ipa.

En fût au Blackpack. Une bière jaune dorée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez peu bavard à la limite fade. La bouche est sur le même registre avec une drôle damertume herbacée. Elle est fade et manque de oumphe.

12oz can into glass. Pours a modest tan peach. Firm white, fluffed head, cloud lacing. Aroma of a danty ipa, cone hops, pine, orange, melon. Taste of the same, yet missing the hop bite in in end, substituted by a rather bland diet beer taste, such is the session. Great aroma, poundable, decent.

Amazingly fresh and fluffy. Although rich, west coast hops define this beer, it doesnt ever become cloying or sticky. In fact, it is almost quaffable. Refreshing and light for such a style, but also remarkably flavorful.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Bright, pale hued orange. Powerfully dank and softly spicy dry-hopped aroma and flavor. Dried herbs provide some snappiness amidst the resins. Field grasses and hints of metallic, earthy tang keep the citrus piths and white peach juices from shining so brightly. Simple honeyed grains are there in adequate, balancing quantity.  An herbal, weedy dry-hopped chill pervades the flavor.  Lean and addictively crisp mouthfeel. There is no outstanding piquancy here or stunning tropical fruit clarity; this isnt emotive, its effective.

Drinking straight from the can, in true VT fashion. Nice dry hop aroma. Clean crisp up front with some subtle pine and citrus. The dry hops push through, bringing in some bitterness and more pine and citrus. Ending is clean and dry with some lingering citrus.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can: Poured a bright pale yellow color ale with large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral hops with light citrusy notes. Taste is a mix of citrusy hops with light hay flavours. Body is light with good carbonation. Interesting and highly drinkable but did not have the hops kick I was expecting.

En fût au Black Back Pub. Une bière dorée avec une belle tête collante. Au nez, agrumes et herbes, touche dananas piquant, pointe résineuse. Au goût, cest légèrement terreux avec une pointe de conifère, une touche de poivre et un fruité davantage effacé. En bouche, le corps moyen-faible est bien pétillant. La finale montre une amertume colorée par des houblons en herbes et en agrumes. Bien intéressant!

12 oz can. Finally rating this after tons of consumption. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a large white head. Aroma of juicy grapefruit, resiny hops and light funk. Taste is much the same. Amazing how good this is for 4.8%.

Can. Pours clear pale yellow with a decent white frothy to creamy mostly lasting head that leaves scant lacing. Aroma is citrus and lightly roasted nuts. Flavors follow nose, lightly bitter, light body, average carbonation, and a light and clean bitter finish. Solid malt backbone.

Tap. Blackback Pub, Waterbury, VT. Gold, with a light haze. Sticky, white head. Lovely, fresh, tropical fruit hop. Big on the orange zest. Taste is crisp, fresh, pithy bitter. Clean, light body. Zesty bitter finish.
Pours golden with white head. Aroma is fruity citrus. Flavor light citrus with mineral notes. Finishes grapefruit.
12oz can from Pushkinwow, thanks man. Cloudy golden pour with some head. Strong piney and citrus aroma. Taste follows, not too bitter. Pretty good.
Can from Tom - thanks! Blond gold pour with a white head. Tropical fruit and a touch of pine. Clean and easy drinking. Good!

12 oz can from mdg64. Pours slightly hazy pale golden color with white head. Pine and grass aromas. Pine and grass flavor with moderate bitterness. Light to medium body with average carbonation. Thanks Marc.

Draft @ reservoir Waterbury, Vt Citrusy, lightly tropical, piny, light pineapple app: clear pale thick small white head t/p: thin body moderate long bitter finish. Soft carbonation. A nice session hoppy like I enjoy.
Gold pour, foamy white head. Aroma of pine, tangerine, cedar, spice. Flavor of wood, grass, citrus, toasted and caramel malt. Cedary. Very bitter.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. A can thanks to Paul. Light haze on this pale gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is light and soft, decent fine carbonation. Very light and clean pale malts. Floral sweetness in to piney hops. Hop spice. Trace of pineapple. Mellow lemon and a trace of tropical fruits. Light airy finish. Very nice indeed!

Can share on the 42nd floor tasting, thanks to Scopes. 4.8%. Dark yellow, light haze, softly sparkling, small foamy white head. Aroma is celery, lime peel, touch of mint. Body is light, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is lemon, grass, straw, leaves, dried hops straight out of the vacuum pack. Tasty.

Can. Pours a clear golden color with a thick white head that left decent lacing. Aroma of citrus, lemon, pine and grass. Flavor of citrus, pine, lemon, grass, grapefruit and had some dankness. Medium to light body, lively carbonation, bitter finish.
Pours light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of grassy, earthy hops, big grapefruit and pine. Taste follows, light body, crazy drinkable with an explosion of hop flavor.

can recieved in a trade. poured a nice deep golden colour with a nice steady white head on top. nose is nice fruity forward. melons, sweet citrus, and nice oily pine hops. mouthfeel is very smooth and full bodied for the low abv. creamy notes, pineapple juice, tropical fruits, and herbal pine hops. very nice session ipa! lovely

Can split at the 42nd floor Tasting, Fergus Wharf, thanks to Bropey 08/10/15.
Golden yellow with a solid looking egg shell white cap.
Nose is pissy melon balls, tangerine, floral tunes, bread dough, grassy, orange sherbet. 
Taste comprises melon, pine needle, mandarin, grapefruit, passionfruit. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close layered with a juicy hop rinse. 
Solid low boose hop jus.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Clear golden yellow with small white head. Nice aroma of pine and grapefruit. Medium-light body. Pine and citrus hop flavor, bit of malt, flavorful and drinkable. I think they nailed exactly what they were going for here.

Can at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Thanks Paul. Bright yellow greeny coloured pour with a lasting thin white head, light haze. Aroma is nice dank hop, lemon grass, pithy, mango. Flavour is composed of juicy citrus and tropical fruits, mango, peach. Super juicy, Palate is fairly light and refreshing, highish carbonation, sticky hop. Super Session able. Great stuff.
For a sessionable IPA this beer has it all. No lack of malty backbone or mouthfeel. Great hop character.
Sharp resin and light grapefruit aroma. Clear golden color with a small white head. Light bitter throughout with a light palate in the finish.

GABF. A bunch of pours from the can. Pretty clear golden yellow appearance with an off white head. Dank and pine and spicy. Good body. Some tropical fruits. Great... or as I wrote in my notes "dank as balls, fuck yeah." Id love to get buzzed quick on this bullshit.

33cl can st the 42nd level tasting, London. Thanks to Paul for this one. It pours a clean golden color with good white head. Aroma is crispy and hoppy with citrus and apricot. Taste is lightly sweet with full rich hops. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very good

12oz can from Hunger Mountain Coop pours a mostly clear gold with some lacing, soapy, white head. Nose has bright soap, bright lemon peel, grass, some perfume too, some tangerine. Flavor is light with honey, grass, lemon, tangerine, some pine, lightly vegetal, some soap. Clean, refreshing finish and super drinkable.

Clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is a little piney. Flavor is light, big one and a slightly astringent finish.

Wife: 3.75

Medium white head with fair retention, skimpy lace.Hazy, gold color. Nose is groovy with lemon, grass and a spicy dankyness. Light bodied, prickly carbonation.Fruity, flowery hops on the palate, dry toasty malts along with big citrus and stone fruits, bit resiny and a hint yeasty. Reasonably bitter finish thats dry and friggin yummy. Could plow through some of these easily! Yummy lil critter! Thanks Paul, SL.

Can obtained in VT. Pours a clear pale yellow, white head big bubbles. Aroma is grass, light piss, citrus, spices, funky floral hop, pineapple. Light and mildly sweet flavor, heavy citrus rind and dry bitterness and earthy minerals. Light body and absurdly drinkable. Very very enjoyable "crushable"

Une bière blonde assez claire offre une mousse moyenne et tenace. Des céréales franches saccouplent avec des arômes de lime et de gazon fraîchement coupé. Je salive déjà. En bouche, cest une véritable limonade gazéifiée, supportée par du malt pâle croquant. Les saveurs fruitées saffalent dans une finale à lamertume persistante, mais pas trop violente. Content que ce produit se retrouve en canette.

Can (about seven weeks old). Pours a hazy pale orange with a white head that leaves behind messy lacing after a few sips. Smells of citrus fruits, orange, tangerine, maybe some tropical notes in the background. Taste is similar. Lightly bitter. Has enough body to keep this from being hop water.

12oz can pours clear amber with 2 finger head. Nose is mango, melon, peach, orange. Taste is light bodied, grassy orange melon mango, backed by medium bitterness and a touch of biscuit. Finishes dry, mild bitterness, grassy orange, mango, light piney fruit and a touch of malt.

12oz can from HBT trade. Pours a burnt straw color with a thick frothy white head. Aroma of juicy tropical fruit, clementines, and pale bready malts. Taste of tropical fruit zest, sweet clementine, dry bready malts, and grass. Solid

Can thanks to Paulo. Gold pour with a small head. Lemon, tree bark and pepper on the nose. Somewhat dank. Flavor is pretty dry and earthy. Pepper, pine. Slightly astringent, but Still very drinkable. Good.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Pours golden with good head retention. The aroma is of a subtle tropical hops with some pine scent. There is a nice crisp malt tone to it too. Tasting, I noticed a light body, good crisp clean malts, and a mild citrus flavor. The finish is lingers of a mild bitterness with an enjoyable dryness. Overall a very good session with a good freshness to it.
Clear orange, lots of sticky foam. Light tropical aroma. Light in the mouth as well, nice bitterness, slightly mineral aftertaste. Very solid, great flavor for a session.

Can at home in CT. picked up yesterday in VT. Pours clear gold with a big, frothy white hed. Lots of zesty and pithy citrus in the aroma, lemon, tangerine, grapefruit. Light sweet flavor, very dry, with plenty of rindy bitterness, some clean minerality, grapefruit pith, faint pine. Light in body with active carbonation. Wonderfully clean and dry on the finish, with further minerals, pithy and rindy citrus, mellow pale malt sweetness. Outstanding stuff. Exceedingly drinkable.
UPDATED: APR 12, 2016 Draft. Pours clear yellow with white head. Nose/taste of pine, citrus, cracker malt and lemon - medium body.
Draft at Gingerman courtesy of MaxxDaddy, thanks! Crystal clear pale yellow, thick fluffy white head. Nice aroma of bright lemongrass and fresh meadow. Taste is bitter grassy lemon. Nice.
Draft. Golden pour with white head. Herbal and grassy hop aromas. Light herbal hops, light sweetness on the finish.

One of the best sessions out there. Nice fruity nose and taste with a bit of clean bitter finish. Only quarrel is that it has the same slight wateriness that a lot of the sessions have. Could drink these all night though as they are tasty and not too filling 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow this was delish. Pure fresh bright tangerine nose. Decent body for a session. Dry finish. Anne loved it.

Draught at Gingerman NYC. It pours clear gold with a thick white head. The nose is soft, fresh, grassy, bitter - sweet, dankness, pine, bread, sour blackberry and marmalade. The taste is crisp, clean, bitter, grassy, dankness, floral, light minerals, pine and some grapefruit rind with a dry finish. Light - medium body and moderate carbonation. Well rounded and utterly drinkable. Damn refreshing and crushable. Delicious.

12 oz can. Clear gold with a smooth white head. Nose is orange, honey, pineapple and spring meadow. Crisp and quenching with sharp carb and a surprisingly fuller mouthfeel than one would expect. Taste is sour pineapple, candied lemon peel, grass and quinine. Packed full of flavor for a session brew.
Tap. Amber pour with a white head. Citrus, bread, pine, grapefruit. Medium body with good carbonation. Great aroma and flavor for a 4.8. Really nice

Sample at the Northeastern Brewery (VT) Tasting on 08/16/2015. Clear bright golden color with a medium ivory white head that dissipates steadily to a film. Spotty lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, grassy hops and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal hops, dank citrus and malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering grassy hops aftertaste. Solid beer all around.
Lawsons always putting out a nice crushable brew. Vermont owns the beer world. Keep up the great brews be on top in no time.

From CT Hops for Hope. Pour was golden with some haze, nice white head, thins, but laces. Aroma of citrus and pine and herbs. Flavor follows, earthy and herbal touches to the hops. Grains and biscuits in the malt base underneath. A very bright and fully flavored IPA for sub 5.0%. I dont need any IPAs when I can get this much flavor in a session. Save the Liver with All The Flavor! Mouthfeel was full and buttery for the style, great drinker.

Cans delivered by Lunch. You are awesome!

Light orange body, mild haze, gargantuan, foamy, white head with lasting retention. Lovely fresh hop aroma. World class IPAs continue to spill out of Vermont. Just a mild bready quality to support the lovely Amarillo hop character. Quaffable and delicious.

Enjoyed at Freetail Bottleshare 2015... Dank hop nose, light body with earthy, spicy and dank hop notes throughout... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz can - thanks Mike! Thousands of floating specks in a hazy gold base. Drying hop nose.. A worthy hop & malt presence for a session IPA.

Une base maltée aérienne, céréalière et peu sucrée, parfaite pour accueillir lélan herbacée/citronnelle et tropical de lAmarillo. Une touche ferreuse, voire minérale ajoute du tranchant à la finale. Sans surprise, excellent.

Lodeur en deux mots : des houblons. Une quantité industrielle de houblons. La couleur assez claire du liquide nous rappelle que nous navons pas affaire à une Double IPA , mais le nez refuse de diminuer sa concentration en cocottes amères pour autant. En bouche, cest drôlement agréable. Il ny a que de lamarillo comme houblon là dedans?? Et bien, considérons alors lamarillo comme un de mes houblons préférés! Cest léger et frais, mais en même temps chargé de notes fruitées. Je la bois après une Sip of Sunshine et, à ma grande surprise, je pense ly préférer. Très bon!

Lawsons Finest Liquids help pioneer the New England-style IPA and theyve been doing variations on it ever since including Session IPAs. I didnt have the original incarnation, but Super Session #2 seems to follow the form with huge grassy hop aroma and flavor. This is exactly what you expect in a Vermont SIPA.

I poured a 12oz can into a mason jar. It was canned on 8/5/15 and cost $2.10 ($0.18 per ounce). Thanks to Jon H. for this can!

Appearance: Slightly hazy shade of dark gold. Pours to a fairly large, white head of soapy suds  most of which dissipates and leaves a little lacing.

Smell: Huge hop aroma, especially of grass, garlic and onion. Pleasant, but maybe even a bit too potent.

Taste: The New England IPAs are known for being very grassy and herbally, though I say this one is a little stronger than most in that facet. Though it mentions the use of Amarillo hops on the can (which usually create for orange aromas and flavors), I get a hop character of garlic and onion and dried grass. Its lightly fruity for a moment; akin to maybe citrus pith, but then changes quickly to a spice rack taste. A very tingly sensation on the tongue with a firm drying sensation right as it goes down. Theres enough malt to give it both body and balance, but not so much as to give it much distinctiveness (which is fine by me). These flavor components tend to work better in bigger brews (e.g. Heady Topper), but are a bit odd in a SIPA.

Drinkability: The can clearly indicates a 4.8% ABV, which is certainly sessionable, but on the higher end of the Session IPA spectrum. It has the mouthfeel of something lighter, though; its noticeably thin but it is quite crisp and stays well carbonated til the last drop. Its not refreshing, in my opinion, but I could see it accompanying a summertime lunch quite well. 

RATING: 8/10

12oz can thanks to Rob. Poured a hazy rusty gold with a larger foamy white head. Aroma of dry grassy hop cones, earth, lemons, biscuit and toast. Flavor of old orange rinds, lemon, biscuit, toast and dirty citrus. Full lively carbonation and a medium/full mouthfeel with a lingering aftertaste.

12 pack of cans drunk fresh over the course of about a month, July and August 2015.Lovely pour, bright and light golden with plentiful carbonation and a rocky white head with good retention."Fuzzy" fruit skin, leafy-green amarillo notes in the nose are very enjoyable and backed by a dry, very slightly grainy malt character that also adds a touch of honey. Mild citrus, guava and starfruit notes linger, with a bit of peppery herbs. At no point over the course of drinking these did I find any of the hop notes going South nor any dirtiness/cattiness sometimes associated with the delicate amarillo hop.The flavor is marked by a not-too-grainy (but just enough) malt bill with some softer honey notes with warming and tons of zesty, lightly herbal and citrusy hop notes. But its a more flavorful citrus, less so a bitter, dry, acidic one. Ample, mostly tight carbonation, nicely attenuated, crisp on the end. Maybe a touch more breadiness than Id like, but pretty hard to dislike this thing. Still seems like its trying to be bigger than it is, which is what all/most of the session IPAs are doing (which I hate), but I guess thats a session ale. Otherwise it would just be a hoppy golden ale? I dont know. Clean, refreshing and flavorful, with the hops well-treated.
Clear darker golden body, thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Light florals, citrus, vegetal notes, some cut grass. Medium to light bodied, moderate carbonation, and mild bitterness.

Can dated 08/05/2015.
This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was a soft semi-hazy yellow to orange color with a one finger sustaining white foamy fingers worth of head. It must last for a good minute and a half before even deciding to dissipate. Lacing was here and there, not much really.
The smell starts off with freshly cut sweet grass, a light lemon, and ever so sly amount of sweet onion. Bittersweet and nice.
The taste follows the smell and bringing a soft sweet oily onion flavor sliding over my taste buds. A sweet onion to grassy aftertaste runs into the finish.
On the palate, this has a light bodied feel with a nice crisp sessionability about it. Carbonation runs appropriate for the session IPA style and hits the spot letting a light bitterness to roll about.
Overall, if treated as a session IPA, it works, but I must admit the IBUs are pretty low in this one. To me, I dig it.

Pours clear gold into a Sam glass. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Sweet dough and hay aromas. Soft with hay and bread upfront turning to mild resin in the dry finish.

Pours golden yellow with orange hue and a small white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: citrus, passion fruit, lemon drops candy, pineapple, lightly malty, herbal/floral hops, grassy bitterness, light spruce, lemon zest, tangerines, spice, herbs and caramel. TASTE: hop spice, grass bitterness, lemon drops, spruce bitterness, pineapple, tangerines, spice, peppercorn, herbs, leaves, citrus, malty, tropical fruit, sweet and slight melon. AFTER TASTE: hop spice, citrus, malty and pine bitterness with an oily slightly dry finish.
Can. Gold with white head. Citrus, pine and resin. Slightly watery, lightly spritzy carb. Solid.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2015 Can. Bright gold, lacing. Dank juicy hops, floral, light pine and resin. Big lemon zest and pineapple notes. Super clean with semi-Spritzy carb. Top notch session ipa all around. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce can shared at a tasting. Clear golden, thin tan head, fair retention. Aroma of citrus, tropical, piney hops, pale malt. The taste is juicy citrus hops, some pine and resin. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2015 Can shared by t$. Nose is straight cat piss and grass. A tad thin in malt and overly bitter. Ok but not a huge fan.
Can to glass. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is citrus, danky, yum. Taste is light, hoppy, a bit pissy. Nice beer.

Pours a slightly hazed, sun-yellow color, with a big, stable white head.

Offers intriguing aromas of lemon zest, hints of orange and a distinct dankness, gently balanced by bready malts. Its exotic fruit notes stand out of the hop profile, highlighting its crisp freshness, adding just a hint of sweet honey. 

Has a very light, aqueous mouthfeel, which leaves a very refreshing impression.

Tastes of juicy lemon, bready, dough malts and a soft aqueous mouthfeel. Hops turn a bit fizzy, due to a higher, slightly metallic carbonation, putting the spotlight almost more on the sweeter turning malts, than on the hops. During the beers finish, crisp lime peel settles on top of the malts, leading to a decent hoppy, but slightly watery finish.

The beer is in fact very sessionable, something I appreciate more and more as of lately, while this pushes it a bit too far. Hops turn present from the malts only for a short glimpse, while finishing too watery, without providing the neccessary body, even for a session ale.
Green hued pale golden fine white foam, lemon, melon, very floral, geranium, rose. Woah. Light body, amazing

On tap, sampled during the early April VT road trip at Black Back. Clear vibrant copper with an off white pour that settles to a light cloud-like topping. Some freshly squeezed OJ with a tangy combination of lemon and orange zest, some grapefruit, wet hops and hemp, hint of resin. Moderate carbonation and body, easy to drink and enjoyable.
Can thanks to Team Boston. Pours a cloudy gold with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong pine and floral. Medium mouth, grass, citrus, light bitter finish.
On tap at cask republic . Lacy citra aroma session. Aarillo. Is featured. Good although surprising palate erasing.

Draft at the cornerstone. Pours a clear golden color with medium sudsy white head. Aromas of citrus and wheat. Flavor had some citrus notes, pale malts, and wheat. Very sessionable and a style I love. Light body and thin texture. Lively carbonation to it and smooth finish. Crushable.
Tap at Blackbird Pub. Amber. Nice lasting white head. Strong hop and alcohol nose. More gentle than aroma indicated. Flavour still has some gasoline notes. Strong hops.
Big hop aroma with pineapple, mango and "pure hop dankness". Taste is very easy, not watery and has a wheat like mouthfeel, not completely dry and very sessionable.

Draft at 3 Penny. Pours orange gold with an off white head. Aroma is mango, pineapple, grapefruit. Flavor follows, nice and juicy... Pineapple, grapefruit, mango, some grassy bitterness in the finish.

On tap at Prohibition Pig. Really nice beer here. Big flavor--very much like Sip--but super light bodied and easy going. I could drink this all day. Nice brew from Lawsons with big citrus and lightly sweet malt backing. Yup.

En fût au Réservoir, Waterbury Vt. Dorée, claire, une belle mousse. Au nez, on retrouve plein de conifères, résine de pin, sapin, avec une dose de gazon. Dommage, le gazon vient tout gâcher cette belle forêt boréale. Texture un peu trop mince. Ça reste acceptable.

Pour is clear pale golden amber with a tight white head. Nose has a nice light grain to it, tons of hop citrus and notes of melon. Flavor is a bit sweeter, still lots of citrus, malts get a touch sweet, grain is less pronounced. Melon is rindy, finish is very dry, well carbonated and light bodied.

On tap at Prohibition Pig. Pour is clear golden orange with a big white head and sticky lacing. Orange zesty, lemon peel, biscuit, grassy, floral and doughy aroma. Taste is orange zesty, straw, some grass, citrusy, earthy, some biscuit, and grapefruit with a medium bitter finish. Medium Body with high carbonation. Pretty good session.
Tap. Pours clear golden, small white head, decent lacing. Aroma is light pine, spruce tips. Flavor is very light sweet, light plus bitter. Light body, a bit of a harsh finish.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2015 Draft pour is dark golden in color with a thin layer of white head. Aroma has bright hops, citrus, and is very clean. Mouth feel is medium with good carbonation. Flavor shows the hops nicely, mild resins, extremely drinkable but with loads of flavor. Super session it is! 

Can multiple times. Aroma is awsome fresh and this has become my favorite session. Wish it was easier to get but I will take it where I find it.

On tap at Mad Taco. Hazy pale gold pour with lacy, foamy white head. Aroma is hoppy, nice fruity hop, very citrusy, lemon, grapefruit, light pineapple, light citra like dankness. Taste is bitter, light maltiness, very dry, clean bitterness, very citrusy flavor, tons of pink grapefruit, light dank hop. Palate has nice body, very dry carbonation, easy drinking. Good stuff.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2015 On tap (16 oz) @ Mad Taco. Clear golden with a frothy white head and heavy lacing. Dank hops, citrus/pink grapefruit, quite herbal and biscuity malts. Taste is also of citrus/pink grapefruit, dank hops, a good biscuity malt backbone and moderate bitterness. Medium body. Never watery. Medium carbonation. Dry and herbal finish. Another super tasty and sessionnable beer in the Lawsons ways.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2015 On tap at Three Penny.
Pours golden with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, fruits. Taste is of bitterness, fruits, resin, citrus. Palate: Medium-high carbonation, light body. Overall: Very nice stuff. Tasty. Refreshing. [Edit: Had this one again at Pro Pig. Scored slightly lower, but nothing serious. Still pretty good, similar.]
Tap at read our. Pours clear gold lots of grassy hops on nose. Flavours onion grapefruit. Med bitter light sweet. Med body lively carb.
Draft at Mad Taco. First rate fresh light IPA. Green dusty hops, a little grapefruit. Very nice sweet aroma. Amarillo says Adrian.

on tap at three penny taproom, VT. citrus burst - clementines, oranges, bergamot oil; lightly danky mangoes, pale bready lightly toasyed maltiness, grass, minerals. average carbonation, light body - not quite watery, balanced bright citrusy finish. impressive balance and bright/fragrant hop. totally sessionnable ipa.

Pours a clear golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of oranges and other citruses. Taste is moderately bitter and hoppy. Nice fruity taste. All that in a 4.2% ABV brew? Consider me subscribed. Body is light to medium and carbonation high and lightly prickly. It never felt watery and is just a lot of flavor for such a small beer. Id drink that all the time if I could!

On tap in a tulip. Pours hazy copper with a white head. Aroma of light citrusy and fruity hops, some pale and light caramel malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a decent blend. Average texture. A decent session IPA.

Draft at Reservoir. Pours slightly hazy pale gold with almost no head. Aroma is grassy and herbal with some marijuana-y dankness, citrus peel, and lightly tropical notes. Taste is grassy and citrusy hops mingling with doughy, crackery, almost Pilsner-like malts. Drying and bitter finish, light but still smooth and oily mouthfeel. Pretty nice.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz déguste chez Farmhouse Tap & Grill (Burlington, VT) au coût de 7,00$. Arôme: Légère odeur dagrumes et de pin. Apparence: La couleur est orangée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle le verre. Saveur: Goût dagrumes avec une pointe de pin. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dagrumes en arrière goût. (Rating #6149)

Had on tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill, January 26th. $3.00 for the 6oz./half-pint. To tulip, it pours a light orange with which asudsy white head half a finger in length stood.

Aromas of cilantro, chives, sour grass, sidewalk chalk, 6-row, spelt, honeydew melon, sweat, damp newspaper, and minerals. 

Tastes the same with the addition of chamomile blossoms, American hops, and straw. Grassy and oh so delightful. 

Always up for Lawsons.
Tap @ Hotel Vermont. Pine, grass, and citrus. Very easy going and packed with light hoppy flavor. Session IPA worth a try if you can somehow stumble upon.
Pours gold with a white lacing. Amarillo forward, citrus grass and pine. Heavily Amarillo forward, flavorful session ipa

Draft. Pours deep yellow with a thin white head that clings to the edges of the glass. Medium carbonation. Mild aroma for Lawsons; however, superior complexity for a session. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Snifter on draft at Worthy Burger. Bright shining gold color with lasting head retention. Aroma has a ton of citrus notes with a nice floral character. 
The floral and grassy hints come out during the finish with the citrus upfront. The bitterness is clean and refreshing. Mild dank note hiding in here as well. This is a ridiculous clean, crushable brew, awesome! The snifter was gone in about 5 minutes.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 My Bottom Line:
Potent resins unsurprisingly dominate this Pale Ale, whilst mild honey and citrusy accents create refreshment.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam laces atop the misty golden.
-This is appropriately quenching.
-While this may not be as complex as most of Lawsons portfolio, it is as efficient as can be in its aims.
-Carbonation is bubbly and the mouthfeel is relatively lean.
-The resinous hops take over the finish as well.

Cans and on tap at Farmhouse Tap and Grill, Burlington.
brewed in CT, sampled at mikro. Clean ipa, good hop and medium body, light bitter finish, Nice to see the beers that come out of two roads still at Lawsons quality.

Dark orange. Slightly cloudy. 2 finger creamy head. A ton of citrus and herbs on the nose. Smells like a baby double sunshine. Incredibly bitterness. Silly mouthfeel with a bit of mineral water.delicious sort of like every other sean IPA.

Cask at Mad Taco with Vinny and Keith at 8am. So this is what its come to. Pours a beautiful, murky pineapple juice body with thick creamy head of white. Nice lacing. Nose is funky melon, sweet citrus and fresh pine hop. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy with notes of pineapple juice, dank herb, pine needles and freshly squeezed citrus juice. Very sessionable.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 on cask at mad taco. Pours super murky golden orange with light head that faded. Notes are juicy grapefruit, melon, pineapple, and pine. Ultra dank beverage at 830 in morn. Tried a newer batch on 1/1/15, clearer orange color with notes of clean lemon and orange hop. Different but still a winner in my book
